dict.string:
My highschool had a nice library, there were lots of great books there. But there was a hallway that had every book you would imagine about programming.
So I read...
Javascript, PHP, C, C++, Objective-C, Java. I wanted to learn them all.
But I soon discovered, the best way to learn something is making mistakes. So I choose C for my first project. Failed a bunch of times, until I managed to create "Serpens"

It was a copy of the classic Snake's game. But it made my programming skills sync with my creativity.
And I loved it.
